text: Hi I found there is an error when I deploy the chaincode_example02 in docker
<@U21NTHK7C|wangbin767> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/wangbin767/F2M0Z6LGY/-.txt|Untitled>

file.name: -.txt
file.title: Untitled
file.preview:
vp0_1  | 10:31:33.158 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO c8c Error building images: Error: image hyperledger/fabric-ccenv:x86_64- not found
vp0_1  | 10:31:33.158 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO c8d Image Output:
vp0_1  | ********************
vp0_1  | Step 1 : FROM hyperledger/fabric-ccenv:x86_64-
vp0_1  | Pulling repository docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-ccenv
file.preview_highlight:
vp0_1  | 10:31:33.158 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO c8c Error building images: Error: image hyperledger/fabric-ccenv:x86_64- not found
vp0_1  | 10:31:33.158 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO c8d Image Output:
vp0_1  | ********************
vp0_1  | Step 1 : FROM hyperledger/fabric-ccenv:x86_64-
vp0_1  | Pulling repository docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-ccenv

text: it seems there are missing of fabric-ccenv in the images, how can I fix this error?
Build from source
That's the only supported mode right now.  We are working on the binary distribution
guys - there's no datetime column field in the Table interface right ?
you mean as a column type ?
if so no
yeah
<@U0ULK2JPP> I saw there were plans for SQL-like query support in the future
so I'm wondering if this Table interface will become something like a SQL table with foreign keys to other tables and full support for other column types?
let me refer to <@U1KFCPFQA>

The focus for now is on JSON support, to support complex objects without the more painful relational/table mapping.  There are good options out there for sql-like query across JSON documents.  That said, we’d like to make the data architecture pluggable so that a table metaphor could be plugged in backed by relational tables.  Let me ask this - is there a specific reason you want to use a table metaphor instead of a json document metaphor?
well a json metaphor will be ideal
my application requires JSON(or XML) documents coming in
I want to parse those and store them somehow in the chain so that I can query fields later
my case is that I don't have to EDIT or DELETE old records - just add new ones and be able to query
<@U1KFCPFQA> does that make sense ?

very much makes sense.  so the work that is beginning now will help you a lot - chaincode persisting json documents backed by a data store that supports json query.  i am working on a proposal this weekend and will post an updated presentation, watch the fabric-ledger-dev channel for updates
oh that would be awesome
<@U1KFCPFQA> are you guys creating a new engine or trying to accommodate an existing DB ?
excellent, will look forward to getting your detailed feedback after i post
it will be pluggable, looking at couchdb as an initial data store
<@U0KPFAZNF> is that means I can’t use any image pulled from docker hub?
<@U21NTHK7C>  - you need to build the `fabric-ccenv` image from src but you can use all the other images from Dockerhub
you can also likely just do `docker tag hyperledger/fabric-peer:latest hyperledger/fabric-ccenv:latest` as well if working with Golang chaincode
<@U21NTHK7C>: as <@U0PB67X4K> said:  it's not that the images there aren't usable, they just aren't complete
I concur with <@U0PB67X4K> s workaround
We are working on making a complete set available in one of the upcoming releases
finally I have successfully run the chaincode_example02…. thanks <@U0KPFAZNF>  and <@U0PB67X4K>
Yw
there are a missing in the instruction of this <https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Chaincode-setup/>
sorry, should be this one <https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Network-setup/>
you have to tag the fabric-baseimage and only after that the chaincode can run correctly.
I think somebody should amend this instruction ,add “docker tag hyperledger/base-image:latest hyperledger/fabric-peer:latest” after “docker pull hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc:latest"

<@U2LHDBZM0|abhisingh> commented on <@U2LHDBZM0|abhisingh>’s file <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/abhisingh/F2LMD9KGW/-.sh|Untitled>: Hi <@U0KPFAZNF> and <@U0PB67X4K>, Please help me to solve this problem I am facing while deploying chaincode.

comment.comment: Hi <@U0KPFAZNF> and <@U0PB67X4K>, Please help me to solve this problem I am facing while deploying chaincode.

text: <@U2LHDBZM0>  - are you running the peer using docker-compose?  can you share your compose file?  if not running in Docker, can you share your core.yaml or start command used for the peer?
looks like you somehow have the wrong value for `CORE_VM_ENDPOINT`
